key_events.description: Marcopolo approved a dividend of R$0.69 per share and JCP of R$0.09 per share, with payments starting December 15, 2025.
JPMorgan reiterated an overweight recommendation with a price target of R$ 11. Itaú BBA reiterated a buy recommendation and a price target of R$ 12.
POMO3 is up year to date in January 2026, starting at R$5.55 and currently at R$6.15.
JPMorgan anticipates a positive impact from the new Caminho da Escola program auction and sales to the Ministry of Health (up to 3,000 buses).

risk_factors: Cooling off of deliveries expected from December 2025 due to collective vacations extending into early January 2026.
Domestic market recorded a fall of about 8% in the third quarter of 2025.

investment_thesis.bull_case: Marcopolo is viewed as a compelling dividend stock for 2026, with Nord Investimentos expecting a dividend yield of around 9%. JPMorgan anticipates a positive impact from the Caminho da Escola program. Itaú BBA and JPMorgan have buy recommendations with price targets of R$ 12 and R$ 11, respectively.
investment_thesis.bear_case: Deliveries are expected to cool off from December 2025 into early January 2026. The domestic market recorded a fall of about 8% in the third quarter of 2025. Goldman Sachs has a neutral rating with a price target of R$ 14.80.
